moves.9. Qxa7: I take the Pawn. If an end game is reached, the two connected passed pawns on the Q side may prove to be a boon.
moves.9... Bc5 10. Qa4 Nb6 11. Qb3: I get my Queen out of harm's way.
moves.12... Bxf3 13. Nxf3: Now my Knight is on its natural square.
moves.13... Ne4 14. d4: I force back the Black B.
moves.14... Be7 15. h4 Bb4+ 16. Kf1: My King is probably safer here than on the half-open KN file.
moves.19... Ra8 20. Qb3: I duck clear and attack the Knight.
moves.20... Qd6 21. Rg1: This is why I didn't mind not castling. Now my Rook has a clear field of  fire at Black's King.
moves.21... Rb8 22. Qd3: I don't want to be exposed to a discovered attack.
moves.22... Qb4 23. b3: I try do drive back the Rook.
moves.26... h5 27. Ng5: Attempting to remove Black's well-posted Knight.
moves.28... Rxc3 29. Rc1: Now the Rooks come off the board.
moves.29... Rxc1 30. Bxc1: We've reached the end game, and my connected passed Pawns suddenly loom large.
moves.30... g6 31. Kf3: Naturally, I want my King over near the main action.
moves.32... Nd7 33. Bf4: Time to get this piece back into play.
moves.36... e5 37. dxe5: I'll gladly swap pawns on the K-side.
moves.37... fxe5 38. Bc7: Keeping a watchful eye on both my advanced Pawn and Black's central wedge.
moves.39... Nc5 40. b4: Black wins one of the Q-side Pawns...
moves.41... Nxb4 42. Kxg6: I counter by gobbling a pawn on the K-side.
moves.42... Nd3 43. exd3: Black inexplicably throws away a piece.
moves.43... exd3 44. Bf4: I hasten to block the pawn's progress.
moves.44... Ne5+ 45. Kxh5: Now my K-side is also a threat.
moves.46... Kf7 47. f3: I want to free my B from guarding Q2.
moves.47... Ke6 48. Nf2: The advanced Black pawn will fall.
moves.48... Kd7 49. Nxd3: If Black stops me on the Q-side I can now advance on the K-side.
moves.49... Na7 50. Bb8: Black's last piece will fall, so Black resigns. [50... N-any 51 P-R7 NxP 52 BxN.]
